page.title: 14CHILDHOOD IN ADELAIDE(i)
page.content: This account is taken from an interview with a lady who lived in Queen Adelaide as a child in the 1950s'.She lived in a semi_detached house on the river bank; it had three bedrooms but no bathroom, flush toilet or electricity because the mains services did not reach as far as Adelaide. The house had a large garden and her father grew all the vegetables they needed and kept a pig and some chickens. It was isolated because they had no car and there was only one bus a week, to Ely on Thursdays-Market Day. She had to walk two miles to school at Prickwillow. There were forty children in the school, all taught by the same teacher.They had school sports in the summer and a village fete.
